Module guigame
Package guigame.gui.main

Class GUIGameBoardWindow

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
javax.swing.JWindow
guigame.gui.main.GUIGameBoardWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer
public class GUIGameBoardWindow
extends javax.swing.JWindow
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
Window for the GUIGameBoard. Implements MouseMotionListener to move the paddles.
See Also:
GUIGameBoard, Serialized Form

    • GUIGameBoardWindow

  • Method Details

    • init

      private void init()
      Initializes the frame and calls initNextPoint.

    • initNextPoint

      public void initNextPoint​(boolean right, boolean wait)
      Potentially wait 5 seconds. Hide the game board if it is currently shown and shows the button to start new point.
      Parameters:
      right - Whether the next point should start with the right player or not.
      wait - Whether to wait before the execution (when a point is over and the current board should stay displayed for 5 more seconds without moving anything

    • createStartNextPointButton

      private void createStartNextPointButton​(boolean right)
      Creates a button (empty background) which starts the ball (for the next point).

      On click, the game board is mounted.

      Parameters:
      right - Whether the x-speed should be positive (the ball goes to the right) or negative (object goes to the left).

    • startGameButtonActionListener

      private void startGameButtonActionListener​(boolean right)
      Start the game since the StartGame button was triggered.
      Parameters:
      right - whether the first point should start with the right player or not (so left player)

    • showPointWinningLabel

      public void showPointWinningLabel​(boolean right)
      Create a label displaying a nice message to the person who won the last point and show it.
      Parameters:
      right - whether the right player has won the last point or not
      See Also:
      removePointWinningLabel()

    • removePointWinningLabel

      private void removePointWinningLabel()
      Remove label from window if it is shown.
      See Also:
      showPointWinningLabel(boolean)

    • updatePointLabels

      public int[] updatePointLabels​(int winningPointPlayer) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      Add a point to the GUI for the player who has won the latest point
      Parameters:
      winningPointPlayer - Player which has won the last point
      Returns:
      The new score of both players in an array (to check for a winner??)
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the index for the player is out of bounds (0, 1)

    • mouseDragged

      public void mouseDragged​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      EMPTY!!! Invoked when a mouse button is pressed on a component and then dragged. MOUSE_DRAGGED events will continue to be delivered to the component where the drag originated until the mouse button is released (regardless of whether the mouse position is within the bounds of the component).

      Due to platform-dependent Drag&Drop implementations, MOUSE_DRAGGED events may not be delivered during a native Drag&Drop operation.

      Specified by:
      mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed

    • mouseMoved

      public void mouseMoved​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Invoked when the mouse cursor has been moved onto a component but no buttons have been pushed.

      Updates the paddle if the game is running and the right player is marked as human.

      Specified by:
      mouseMoved in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed
